name: 蕭榮修
objective: This course introduces students to probability, random variables and fundamental statistics. Topics include fundamental probability theory, random variables, distribution functions, Bernoulli, binomial, negative binomial, geometric, hypergeometric, and Poisson distributions. The other continuous topics covered are uniform, exponential, normal, gamma and beta distributions; joint distributions; properties of expectation, central limit theorem, Chebyshev inequality, and law of large numbers; fundamental statistics.
schedule:
1. Introduction to Probability and Statistics 
2. Introduction to Probability Theory - I
3. Introduction to Probability Theory - II 
4. Introduction to Probability Theory - III
5. Random Variables, Expected Value, and Variance
6. Discrete Random Variables - I
7. Discrete Random Variables - II
8. Discrete Random Variables - III
9. Mid-term Exam
10. Continuous Random Variables -I
11. Continuous Random Variables -II
12. Continuous Random Variables -III
13. Jointly Distributed Random Variables
14. Properties of Expectation
15. Limit Theorems - I
16. Limit Theorems - II
17. 自主學習與總複習
18. Final Exam
